sn35.113:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Ñātika in the brick house.
sn35.113:1.2: Then while the Buddha was in private retreat he spoke this exposition of the teaching:
sn35.113:1.3: “Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:1.4: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:1.5: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:1.6: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn35.113:1.7: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
sn35.113:1.8: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn35.113:1.9: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
sn35.113:1.10: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn35.113:1.12: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:1.13: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:1.14: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:1.15: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn35.113:1.16: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
sn35.113:1.17: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
sn35.113:1.18: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
sn35.113:1.19: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn35.113:2.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:2.2: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:2.3: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:2.4: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn35.113:2.5: When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
sn35.113:2.6: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn35.113:2.7: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn35.113:2.8: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn35.113:2.10: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and ideas. The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.113:2.11: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.113:2.12: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.113:2.13: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn35.113:2.15: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn35.113:3.1: Now at that time a certain monk was standing listening in on the Buddha.
sn35.113:3.4: “Monk, did you hear that exposition of the teaching?”
sn35.113:3.9: That exposition of the teaching is beneficial and relates to the fundamentals of the spiritual life.”
